title: Feminist Intersectionality-Based Educational Design Self-Ethnography Study

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational instructional design theories and specialized knowledge in technical fields
context.additional_context: Professionals from diverse backgrounds explore methods to apply feminist intersectional approaches to instructional design through mobile-accessible microlearning content

learning_goals: Learners can analyze structural biases in educational design settings based on feminist intersectionality theory.
Learners systematically reflect on the connections between personal experiences and educational design practice using autoethnographic methodologies.
Learners can transform intersectionality-based instructional design strategies into microlearning content optimized for mobile environments.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
